name: South of the Great Tryangle: The Return of El Dorado
description: After the conquest and plundering of the Inca empire by the Spaniards, the Amerindians in their misery invented the fable of the golden land El Dorado, which was found in the impassable marshes of the Amazonian rivers. We locate a guide to navigate the shamanic flows of the Orinoco basin, its sacred geography. Because of a geological event, this region displaced from its surroundings, becoming a sort of temporal patchwork. The place is misrepresented in the maps, the forest expands fractally too
